paper_title.ja: A new thin-type bronchoscope improves diagnostic accuracy of peripheral pulmonary carcinoma.

paper_title.en: Rupture of the descending thoracic aorta caused by blunt chest trauma: Report of a case

description.en: A 66-year-old man fell from a tree and was diagnosed to have multiple fractured ribs and hemopneumothorax based upon the chest roentogenogram findings. He underwent chest tube drainage and evacuation using video-assisted thoracic surgery. One week after the operation, he exhibited recurrent hemothorax. He underwent a thoracotomy, and the hemothorax was found to be due to a penetration of the lower descending thoracic aorta by a fractured rib. We performed a direct closure of the penetrated portion of the descending thoracic aorta. The patient has remained well for I year following the second operation.

paper_title.en: Imprint cytologic features of pulmonary sclerosing hemangioma - Comparison with well-differentiated papillary adenocarcinoma

description.en:
BACKGROUND. Sclerosing hemangiomas (SH) of the lung are uncommon tumors and are thought to be benign. However, histogenesis of these tumors has not yet been characterized adequately. Moreover, there are few reports dealing with their cytologic features, and it is generally considered difficult to make accurate diagnoses of sclerosing hemangiomas that have a predominantly papillary pattern.
METHODS. Cytologic features were analyzed for 15 sclerosing hemangiomas, and cytologic features of sclerosing hemangioma were compared with features of 22 cases of well-differentiated papillary adenocarcinoma classified as pathologic Stage 1A.
RESULTS. Blood and round cells were observed more frequently in SH than in adenocarcinomas (P < 0.05), whereas necrosis was seen more frequently in adenocarcinomas than in SH (P < 0.05). The presence of nucleoli, nuclear indentations, irregularities of nuclear margins, nuclear polymorphisms, and high nuclear-cytoplasmic (NC) ratios of tumor cells were observed less frequently in SH. Polynuclear (having three or more nuclei) tumor cells were observed only in adenocarcinoma cases. In morphometric studies, the nuclear areas, cytoplasmic areas, NC ratios, long axes of nuclei, short axes of nuclei, and nuclear rotundity ratios were significantly higher in adenocarcinoma cells than in SH cells (P < 0.05).
CONCLUSIONS. The presence of polymorphous cells and turner cells with bland nuclei are characteristic cytologic findings associated with sclerosing hemangioma. It is possible to make accurate diagnoses for SH cases preoperatively by careful cytologic characterization.

肺原発悪性リンパ腫の１切除例と本邦報告例の文献的考察
paper_title.en: Surgical resection of primary pulmonary pmalignant lymphoma ; a case report and a review of the literature in Japan

description.ja: 肺原発悪性リンパ腫は比較的稀な疾患であるが, 免疫組織化学的検索や遺伝子解析が普及した現在その報告例は増加している.今回我々は, 肺原発悪性リンパ腫の1切除例を経験し, 最近の本邦報告例を検討したのであわせて報告する.症例は69歳女性, 1993年8月検診にて胸部異常陰影を指摘され, 当院紹介入院となった.右肺中葉に淡い浸潤影を認め, 経気管支生検にてリンパ腫を疑い右肺中葉切除術兼縦隔肺門リンパ節郭清術を施行した.術後病理診断にて, B細胞型悪性リンパ腫, びまん性中細胞型と診断し, 他臓器に病巣を認めず肺原発と考えた.術後4年経過した現在, 再発なく生存中である.
description.en: Primary pulmonary malignant lymphoma has been a comparatively rare disease, but reports are increasing because of the development of immunohistochemistrical examination and analysis of gene. We experienced a surgical case of primary pulmonary malignant lymphoma. A 69 year-old female was admitted to our hospital for mass survey of lung. There was an infiltrating shadow in the right middle lobe. We suspected it as lymphoma by transbronchial biopsy. The right middle lobectomy with mediastinal lymph node dissection was performed. Pathological diagnosis was malignant lymphoma (Bcell, diffuse medium-sized cell type). We considered it was primary lung tumor because there was no lesion in other organs. She has been well for four years. We reported it with a review of the literature in Japan.

paper_title.ja: 脊柱管内進展を伴った巨大縦隔神経鞘腫の１切除例
paper_title.en: A case of giant mediastinal neurinoma

description.ja:
今回われわれは, 脊柱管内進展を伴った後縦隔巨大神経鞘腫を, 2期的に手術することにより, 安全に摘出し得た症例を経験したので報告する.症例は, 52歳, 男性.検診にて, 胸部異常陰影を指摘され紹介入院となった.最大径15cm大の巨大な腫瘤が, 左胸腔内背側を占め, 一部は胸椎脊柱管内へ進展しているのを認めた.経皮針生検にて, 神経原性腫瘍と診断し, 胸腔外後方アプローチにより, 脊柱管内腫瘤を摘除, 6週間後左後側方開胸により, 胸腔内腫瘤切除および, 脊椎固定術を施行した.
術後経過は良好で, 神経学的にも改善を認め, 初回手術より第63病日, 自立歩行にて退院, 2年後の現在再発を認めていない.
description.en:
We report a case of giant mediastinal neurinoma with expansion into the intraspinal canal. We resected the tumor safely with the two-stage operation. The patient was a 52-year-old male. An abnormal shadow in the left lung field was pointed out at a mass survey. The tumor shadow was 15 cm in size, and extended into the intraspinal canal on chest X-ray, CT, and MRI. It was diagnosed as neurinoma by percutaneous fine needle biopsy (PCNB). First we resected the intraspinal portion of the tumor by the posterior route.
Subsequently, the remaining intrathoracic portion of the tumor was resected and reconstruction of the spinal column was performed via the postero-lateral route six weeks later.
Pathological diagnosis was benign neurinoma. The patient improved neurologically, discharged on his foot and had been well after two years.

paper_title.ja: 胃壁外性、有茎性に発育した巨大胃平滑筋肉腫の１症例
paper_title.en: A CASE OF GIANT EXTRAGASTRIC PEDUNCULATED LEIOMYOSARCOMA

description.ja: 症例は52歳の女性で,上腹部に腫瘤を自覚して発症した.心窩部より臍部にかけて16×16cm大の不整形腫瘤を触知した. CT検査では,内部不均一な腫瘤像を認め,上腹部消化管造影検査では,胃粘膜像に異常を認めず小彎側からの壁外性の圧迫像をみとめた.穿刺生検を2度施行したが,確定診断はえられなかった.開腹すると腫瘤は胃後壁から大彎側に回りこんでおり,腫瘤の中心と胃体中部小彎との間に連続性のある茎が認められた.肝転移や腹膜播腫はなく,腫瘤摘出術と胃局所切除術を施行した.標本は大きさ22×15×10cm, 重量は1,770g, 割面は黄色調で線維性の充実性腫瘤であり,病理組織診断は胃平滑筋肉腫であった.有茎性胃壁外性に発育し,しかも径が20cmを超える巨大な胃平滑筋肉腫は稀で,腫瘍の性格上術前に確定診断をつけにくい.腹部腫瘤を触知した場合,本例のような胃平滑筋肉腫も鑑別診断として挙げるべきである.
description.en: A 52-year-old female complained of an upper abdominal tumor. A 16×16cm irregular tumor was palpable from the epigastrium to umbilical region. It was revealed heterogeneous by computed tomography, and it compressed extraluminally from the lesser curvature of stomach in an upper gastrointestinal series. Aspiration biopsy was carried out twice, but histological diagnosis was not established. On operation, the tumor surrounded the stomach posteriorly from the posterior wall along the greater curvature. A peduncle was found to connect with the body of stomach. There was no lymph node metastasis. Excision of the tumor with local resection of the gastric wall was carried out. The excised specimen was 22×15×10cm in size, and 1770g in weight. It was yellow, fibrous and solid in macroscopic appearance. Pathological diagnosis was gastric leiomyosarcoma. Giant extragastric leiomyosarcoma with peduncle is so rare that preoperative diagnosis is very difficult. When a giant abdominal tumor is palpable examined in the upper abdomen, we suggest that gastric leiomyosarcoma should be listed up in differential diagnosis.
